description: From Ancient Greek ἑξαπλᾶ (hexaplâ), neuter plural of ἑξαπλοῦς (hexaploûs, “sixfold”), from ἕξ- (héx-, “hexa-: six”) + -πλοος (-ploos, “-fold”).

entries.meaning: A text presented in six parallel versions, especially (historical) the version of the Old Testament presented in such a fashion by Origen.
